content.question: Read each question carefully. Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Two identical blocks of mass <math alttext="m equals 0.65 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.65</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are initially at rest on horizontal surfaces at position <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. There is negligible friction between the blocks and the surfaces. One end of a spring is attached to each block, and the other end of the spring is attached to a fixed vertical support. The force exerted by the spring on each block is given as a function of the position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> of the block, as indicated by the following equations. Block 1: <math alttext="F equals negative k sub 1, times x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="k sub 1 equals, 10.0 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>10.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> Block 2: <math alttext="F equals, negative k sub 1, times x, for absolute value of x less than or equal to 0.50 meter, where k sub 1 equals 10.0 newtons per meter; and F equals, negative k sub 2, times x cubed, for absolute value of x greater than 0.50 meter, where k sub 2 equals 40.0 newtons per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mi>x</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>for</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>where</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>10.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>for</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>where</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>40.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mtd></mtr></mtable></mpadded></math> Both blocks are pulled <math alttext="0.80 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.80</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> to the right and released from rest. (a) Which block or blocks, if either, exhibits simple harmonic motion?___ Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> only ___ Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> only ___ Both ___ NeitherBriefly justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Read each question carefully. Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Two identical blocks of mass <math alttext="m equals 0.65 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.65</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are initially at rest on horizontal surfaces at position <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. There is negligible friction between the blocks and the surfaces. One end of a spring is attached to each block, and the other end of the spring is attached to a fixed vertical support. The force exerted by the spring on each block is given as a function of the position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> of the block, as indicated by the following equations. Block 1: <math alttext="F equals negative k sub 1, times x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="k sub 1 equals, 10.0 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>10.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> Block 2: <math alttext="F equals, negative k sub 1, times x, for absolute value of x less than or equal to 0.50 meter, where k sub 1 equals 10.0 newtons per meter; and F equals, negative k sub 2, times x cubed, for absolute value of x greater than 0.50 meter, where k sub 2 equals 40.0 newtons per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mi>x</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>for</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>where</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>10.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>for</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>where</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>40.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mtd></mtr></mtable></mpadded></math> Both blocks are pulled <math alttext="0.80 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.80</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> to the right and released from rest. (a) Which block or blocks, if either, exhibits simple harmonic motion?___ Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> only ___ Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> only ___ Both ___ NeitherBriefly justify your answer.

(b)i. Calculate the amount of work required to pull Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> from the equilibrium position to a position <math alttext="x equals 0.80 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.80</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>.

ii. Calculate the amount of work required to pull Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> from the equilibrium position to a position <math alttext="x equals 0.80 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.80</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>.

(c)i. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is released from rest at <math alttext="x equals 0.80 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.80</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. Calculate the time <math alttext="t sub e q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>eq</mi></msub></math> at which Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> passes through the equilibrium position the first time.

ii. If both blocks are released simultaneously from rest at <math alttext="x equals 0.80 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.80</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, which block passes through its equilibrium first?___ Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> ___ Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ___ Same timeBriefly justify your answer.

Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is pressed against the spring by <math alttext="0.40 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.40</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and released from rest. The momentum of the block as a function of time is shown below.(d) At time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, a second block of mass <math alttext="3 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></math> falls straight down and sticks to Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The two blocks then oscillate together. On the grid below, sketch a graph of the momentum of the two-block system as a function of time after time <math alttext="t equals t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.

(e) The second block is removed from the top of Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> oscillates with an amplitude <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>.Use the axes below on the left to sketch a graph of the momentum of Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> as a function of position as Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> moves from left to right.Use the axes below on the right to sketch a graph of the momentum of Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> as a function of position as Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> moves from right to left.

skill.text: 1.C: Create qualitative sketches of graphs that represent features of a model or the behavior of a physical system.
